duties_responsibilities.duty: Create and maintain production databases through coding and utility programs to monitor and enhance database performance.
Direct and lead the team in making changes to the database management system.
Evaluate, plan, and maintain integrated database systems, ensuring data integrity and control redundancy.
Perform data modeling, security recovery procedures, and database search strategies.
Implement, administer, and enhance database security, including disaster recovery procedures and systems.
Manage and maintain large size databases, troubleshoot database software, and engage with software vendors for problem analysis and resolution.
Configure and maintain a highly available database architecture, including Real Application Clusters (RAC) and Data Guard.
Support migration of databases to cloud infrastructure, and assist in the selection of database management software.
Provide support for building development and testing databases, and perform Database refreshes/clones.
Set up infrastructure for databases in datacenters at multiple sites, and support migration of databases across different physical sites.
Assist in benchmarking and threshold testing of databases, as well as with the installation, configuration, and patching of database software.
Ensure compliance with accessibility standards for database administration and data input/output interfaces.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (Master's preferred)
